dialogXML.title: Concerned citizen is not giving up

dialog.line: Yes, I want to speak to the Head please.
She's very tied up in meetings for the next three days I'm afraid. What's it concerning? Perhaps someone else can help?
Yes. I run the shop on the road just near the school. I've been seeing one particular girl being quite badly bullied and I want to do something about it.
I see. So who am I speaking to please?
My name's Johnson. As I say, I run your local shop (and I also have a daughter in year 8).
And you're sure this is a school matter?
Of course it is. She was on her way home from school, in uniform, and was having money extorted from her by another girl. I've watched it happen twice.
But as you say, it was out of school hours....

I know, but I can't believe there's nothing you can do. As your governor said, if this girl's getting a bad time a couple of minutes outside the gate she must be being bullied inside school too.... I spoke to the governor last week but as far as I can see, nothing's happened.
Perhaps she's still dealing with it. These things can take time you know.

Look, I don't want to be rude, but I've looked all this up. I know by law it's not the school's responsibility, but I've made a note of the times. I have one of their names. Taking money from someone else against their will is a crime and the girl doing it is not a child. Do you want me to go to the police saying that the school has failed to act?
We try to work with the police on this kind of thing, Mr Johnson. But do you know what age these girls were?
They were older than my Katie. Maybe year 11. The one being bullied was called Emma, and I think her surname is Green.
There is an Emma Green in year 10 I think. Let me check.... Yes. All right, I think you need to speak to Mr Hannah, he's year 10 head of year. Can you manage tomorrow morning at 9.30?
